page.title: 09Dulverton's Caravan Site
page.content: Summer time has come round again.Cars and caravans fill up the small town.Brakes screech and cars hoot as the traffic comes to a halt.Doors open and people scramble out of thair cars.Fat and thin people,tall and short people,browse around the shops buying cakes and eating ice creams. The caravan site is right by the river where you can enjoy a swim.The smell of bacon and egg drifts on the breeze.Right by the river the campers can buy themselves a drink at The Bridge and laze as the sun beats down.There is a trim trail nearby which is an assault course for adults and children.The campers enjoy walking through Burridge Woods and watching the wildlife.Later you can hear the unzipping of sleeping bags as the campers climb into bed.They talk for a while.Then silence.
